dreams of exploring space. Of course,
my dreams are slightly different now,
but I'm happy I still have my wife by
my side.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAMACARONB:
[UE:Meta key="37af1fcb46ff45d7ab7faded58bded1a" Scale="1"/]One whiff of this brings me back to
the long days of summer, eating ice
cream with my kids. This fragrance
smells like their favorite flavor, bright
and refreshing. At first I didn't want
to try it, but my children insisted. Now
it's my favorite ice-cream flavor too.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAMACARONC:
[UE:Meta key="3e6fd6a8033d4437a2bbeeba3fcd0aae" Scale="1"/]My wife and I have been together for a
long while, but our relationship has
never been as perfectly poised as this
cake. Maybe it's because I'm always
flying around space and she's at home,
trying to keep things together. Hmm...
We really are due for a date night.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAJAMICHIGO:
[UE:Meta key="b4560f2f95c14a71a4195ebd9ed64551" Scale="1"/]This scent is dangerously sweet and
brings to mind concentrated memories
of my wife's adorable smile... But one
can't subsist on sweetness alone. You
also need solid qualities like trust and
patience. Having those is like a big,
hearty breakfast for the soul!
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTACROISSANT:
[UE:Meta key="666d2aa4a48140bf97766bca375c76c6" Scale="1"/]This is an extremely dangerous food.
Its light and airy appearance belies a
rich and indulgent interior. Before
you've finished one, you're already
reaching for the next... Is it even
possible to deny such temptation?
And do I even want to?
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAWAFFLE:
[UE:Meta key="f3c72bd632d44921af1ef08edaad1f87" Scale="1"/]I nap in the pilot's seat sometimes,
but a cushion like this would be a great
alternative. The only weird part is that
it's edible. Does that mean something
or someone could eat it right out from
under you? That's a major drawback.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAPRETZEL:
[UE:Meta key="ad3b4ab2150147fbb2fab0c8959e6a61" Scale="1"/]Its shape is mesmerizing! I only wish I
could understand how it was sculpted.
The more I think about it, the hungrier
I get. Thankfully, the salty and sweet
pillowy interior is as reenergizing as it
is delicious. But then I start thinking
again, and the cycle continues...
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTADICE4SIDED:
[UE:Meta key="0fa3e04bc8cc47838b7c6ac20f73ed44" Scale="1"/]While exploring, I'm often faced with
the difficult question, "Which way do I
go?" North, south, east, or west?
A tool like this could be useful in those
moments. Of course, one roll would be
too random. It'd be best to roll it 100
times and take the average result.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTADICE6WHT:
[UE:Meta key="a7ad56236358496ba5eda8ff6c785dd8" Scale="1"/]When I gaze at this stone, I can feel
my fate being forecasted. It must
know what's going to happen to me!
I'm sure it sees that I'll be hailed as a
brilliant visionary and brave explorer
when I return to Hocotate.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTADICE12:
[UE:Meta key="8a7351659c7246ba83180854ab4d9e32" Scale="1"/]I've lived through some harrowing
events, and the trick to surviving in
space is to prepare for every possible
situation. But this is technically and
literally impossible. Sometimes you
just need to roll the dice, hope for the
best, and let the universe do its thing.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTADICE20:
[UE:Meta key="c1966e17b2144199bf7dda100ecedac3" Scale="1"/]Having to choose 1 out of 20 possible
scenarios during a voyage through
space would be an object lesson in
randomness...and very unfortunate.
On the miniscule chance it should ever
occur, the only solution would be to
throw up your hands and laugh!
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAHANAFUDAA:
[UE:Meta key="6be829533c964924a2a7785593769172" Scale="1"/]I hope to one day celebrate a
high-numbered birthday, but I don't
think there will be any large birds in
attendance at the party. Just think of
how much trouble they could cause!
If space has taught me anything, it's
to plan for the worst-case scenario.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAHANAFUDAB:
[UE:Meta key="b76d145f9c9c4a3db2a88c4c74a2cca6" Scale="1"/]Springtime always reminds me of the
day I moved out of my parents' house.
At first, everything was fresh and
exciting, but I quickly realized that life
on my own was a lot harder than I
expected. I also realized I should thank
my parents for all they'd done for me.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAHANAFUDAC:
[UE:Meta key="76942b6f51024812a684ce0439857819" Scale="1"/]When my son was little, he thought the
moon was just a powdered donut in
the sky. He would cry and cry, "I want
to eat the moooon!" Apparently I was
the same way. These days, he loves to
look at the moon through a telescope.
Guess the apple doesn't fall far...
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAHANAFUDAD:
[UE:Meta key="4f321188717b48f98ba4b9acebf63f6d" Scale="1"/]I love rainy days! They're the perfect
time to catch up on paperwork, relax
a bit, and dream about my next big
adventure. That is, if I have any energy
left after entertaining my kids, who
can't go outside to play when it's wet.
Eh, I'll take what I can get.
OtakaraDescOlimar.OTAHANAFUDAE:
[UE:Meta key="458a0a968f8a45a1887355bed45e1cbd" Scale="1"/]Maybe this object would help increase
productivity at Hocotate Freight.
So would a better spaceship. Hmm...
Maybe it's my fault. If I stopped
miraculously surviving such dangerous
situations, the president might realize
we need to upgrade our equipment.
